page.title: 17ANIMALS AND BIRDS.
page.content: The Rev. J. Thomas of Caerwys who writes the 'Roundabout' articles in the Caerwys Chronicle gave us the following information :- The area is very rich in wildlife and when I retired to Caerwys in 1976. I listed 87 different species of birds I had seen. The smallest birds in the area being the goldcrest and the firecrest. The largest,the heron attracted to this area by the trout fisheries.Fewer pesticides have been used recently allowing plenty of growth in the hedges and many birds have returned to the district including the yellow hammer and the warblers.A buzzard and a barn owl are presently nesting close by.The most unexpected birds seen were the meadow pipit and the osprey. There are plenty of foxes and badgers in the district.
